Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Overpower \O`ver*pow"er\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Overpowered}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Overpowering}.] To excel or exceed in power; to cause to yield by superior power; to vanquish; to subdue; as, the light overpowers the eyes. ``And overpower'd that gallant few.'' --Wordsworth. [1913 Webster]
Syn: To overbear; overcome; vanquish; defeat; crush; overwhelm; overthrow; rout; conquer; subdue. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Overpower \O"ver*pow`er\, n. A dominating power. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
overpower v 1: overcome by superior force [syn: {overmaster}, {overwhelm}] 2: overcome, as with emotions or perceptual stimuli [syn: {overwhelm}, {sweep over}, {whelm}, {overcome}, {overtake}]
